author: Michael Grebosz
text:
Background: A business owner of a mobile coffee service approached the city and asked if he could setup in city hall's parking lot for an hour or so five days a week to have the opportunity to sell his proudcts to city empolyees and the public.
Question(s): Are any municipalities under a similar situation? Did you charge the vendor for the privilidge of allowing a set up in your parking lot? Besides the obvious insurance requirements, health department certification, business tax receipts, etc... are there any other points that could be shared?
Thank you....
title: vendors on city property
